derivation: properly, to stare at (compare G3700 (ὁράω)), i.e. (by implication) to discern clearly (physically or mentally);
strongs_def: by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear
outline:
1. to see with the eyes
  2. to see with the mind, to perceive, know
  3. to see, i.e. become acquainted with by experience, to experience
  4. to see, to look to
    1. to take heed, beware
    2. to care for, pay heed to
  5. I was seen, showed myself, appeared
